Description: Body sherd of South Ionian pottery cup, probably a cup with everted rim; interior glazed black; exterior: reserved band in handle zone; glazed below; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Schlotzhauer suggests that the sherd might come from a Type 5 or Type 9 South Ionian cup with everted rim, but he did not know the join with 1886,0401.266. Type 9 cups were the most common type of South Ionian cups with everted rims found at Naukratis and the shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape.
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 54, no. 4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.097) (Phase 3)
